content:
Hey all, figured we might want a long-lived topic for the JS subgroup somewhere.

@Guy Bedford @Ralph @Dirk Bäumer @Saúl Cabrera

The notes PR from today is here:

https://github.com/bytecodealliance/meetings/pull/397

Docs here:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_enk-oue7pCgR6SKMACAUTS88_ut5V92e35wW1MOeBE/edit

meetings(sig-guest-js): add meeting 2024/08/22 by vados-cosmonic · Pull Request #397 · bytecodealliance/meetings
We read every piece of feedback, and take your input very seriously.
Notes - JavaScript subgroup (BA Guest Languages SIG)
| Attendees: Notes JCO New release for updated wasmtime (https://github.com/bytecodealliance/jco/releases/tag/1.4.4) Guy: are we generating types for deprecated gate? We might need an extra flag for this to ensure that it can be excluded Guy: Other than that, mostly bugfixes, s...
Basically, the meeting notes should match what's in the PR -- though it should have been GDocs -> Github, will try to remember to do that flow next time.
Thanks for keeping on top of the notes today! And that was super quick on the posting, approved.
No problem! Yeah if anyone has any changes, please feel free to make them -- or just leave a comment (here or there) and I'll make them
thanks!

Meetings notes from the latest meeting -- thanks to everyone who dropped in:

https://github.com/bytecodealliance/meetings/pull/445

meetings(js): add meeting notes for 2024/10/16 by vados-cosmonic · Pull Request #445 · bytecodealliance/meetings
We read every piece of feedback, and take your input very seriously.
Hey @Guy Bedford following up here -- an async branch that we can make drafts/PRs against in jco would make it a lot easier to collaborate on the early progress
That makes sense to me, feel free to get that going
Hey @Till Schneidereit @Calvin Prewitt and others that want to join the JS meeting today, it looks like people are out of town/at conferences, so let's cancel for this week?

Please feel free to leave updates in here for respective projects (StarlingMonkey, ComponentizeJS, Jco)

Oh also @Tomasz Andrzejak who isn't in here somehow (and is also on vacation)
Yeah, I'm not able to join today

Jco update

  • Tooling & test improvements for the repo, consistency with things like linting
  • Fixed some UX issues that have been lingering
  • Started update to componentize-js v0.18.0
    • This actually appears to be stuck, an existing example no longer compiles with the newest version of componentize-js, complaining about being unable to find an export.
  • Refactor of debug options passed to componentize (this is blocked on the upstream addition to componentize -- @Till Schneidereit if you wouldn't mind a review there!)
  • Async work is paused right now, because there is a large amount of change going on in the specs and upstream p3-prototyping repo. the rebase onto newer versions of everything needs to be done and may break many things, so I'm pushing that off until we can fix other issues in Jco/cJS (like OOMs, etc)
Ah thanks Calvin! will add something to meetings to the effect that the meeting was cancelled

Hey everyone, JS Subgroup meeting is happening right now:

https://us06web.zoom.us/j/88578179754?pwd=VukbCMl6p3brpUAUcKU36lf2gvKbC4.1

Join our Cloud HD Video Meeting
Zoom is the leader in modern enterprise cloud communications.

Hey @Calvin Prewitt would you mind sharing where the community meetings are uploaded? @Milan (rajsite) was looking for them!

I pointed to https://github.com/bytecodealliance/meetings/tree/main/SIG-Guest-Languages/JavaScript but it looks like the videos aren't uploaded to BCA YT/might be hard to find?

meetings/SIG-Guest-Languages/JavaScript at main · bytecodealliance/meetings
Contribute to bytecodealliance/meetings development by creating an account on GitHub.
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1cIM8ycC6gF707h8Nu383D6pWYxaqugvx?usp=sharing

Hey @Calvin Prewitt what do you think about adding that to the guide? If that's how people should be accessing the recorded meetings it would be great if other contributors could find it easily:

https://github.com/bytecodealliance/meetings/pull/631

feat(js): add meeting recording link by vados-cosmonic · Pull Request #631 · bytecodealliance/meetings
This commit adds a link to the recorded meetings, so contributors can access the previously taken recordings.

Victor Adossi said:

Hey Calvin Prewitt what do you think about adding that to the guide? If that's how people should be accessing the recorded meetings it would be great if other contributors could find it easily:

https://github.com/bytecodealliance/meetings/pull/631

Merged

@Victor Adossi @Tomasz Andrzejak I'll unfortunately not be able to join today's call. My biggest update is that I'm inching closer to having a working solution for rust builtins with reasonably usable bindings in StarlingMonkey, with hopefully a path towards webidl bindings in a next step. All based on servo's bindings, but not using all of servo's JS runtime

Hey @Till Schneidereit would you mind taking another look at https://github.com/bytecodealliance/ComponentizeJS/pull/285 ? I think that can go in now that SM 0.2.0 is out

Update starlingmonkey and bumps package version by karthik2804 · Pull Request #285 · bytecodealliance/ComponentizeJS
This PR pulls in the latest StarlingMonkey, which means we have to drop support for AoT using weval.
woops just realized this is definitely the wrong thread but I can't move the above message to componentizeJS :|
(I can move your message, @Victor Adossi, but am not sure which thread you want it to go to. LMK...)
Ah thank you! If that message could go to #ComponentizeJS > StarlingMonkey update that would be great! :bow: that is the PR for the starlingmonkey update
